Community health centers provide testing & medical care to communities hit hardest by COVID-19. @RepPressley, @SenSanders & I – and 130+ of our colleagues – are urging Congress to provide emergency funding to struggling CHCs to keep their doors open.

In Denmark, starting pay at McDonald’s is about $22 an hour. The workers there get six weeks of paid vacation, a year’s paid maternity leave and a pension plan. Like all Danes, they enjoy universal medical insurance and paid sick leave. This is what a civilized society is about.

THREAD—let's talk about what's happening at Terminal Island prison.

On March 5, I was the first senator to demand the Bureau of Prisons prepare for COVID-19. Then, on April 2, I called on Terminal Island prison to lay out their plan to prepare for COVID-19.

Neither happened.

More than 30 million people are out of work. Economists are comparing our unemployment rate to the Great Depression. And Trump & his GOP allies still don’t have a plan to get us out of this economic disaster. This is a policy failure – and this is a moral failure.
Our nation was forever changed by the sacrifice and heroism shown by the men and women who served during World War II. We remain forever in their debt. #VEDay75

This year appreciation is not enough. Teacher’s are not only the foundation of my life, but also my unconquerable faith in our future. #TeacherAppreciationWeek http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1258785798033465349/pu/img/j6qFqD3IY84ZJcrV.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1258785798033465349/pu/vid/320x400/d_JRYNE6vmn9CMfb.mp4?tag=10

Today's unemployment numbers are staggering. The Trump administration needs to put forward a plan for widespread testing so we can safely reopen our economy. We should also move quickly to send more direct cash payments to the tens of millions of Americans who are now struggling. https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1258739166029975552 QT @NPR NEW: The U.S. unemployment rate soared to 14.7% in April — the highest level since the Great Depression.

The Labor Department says 20.5 million jobs were lost last month, wiping out most of the gains of the past decade.
https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/05/08/852430930/one-for-the-history-books-14-7-unemployment-20-5-million-jobs-wiped-away?utm_term=nprnews&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=npr

The last time our country saw unemployment numbers like this, we had a president and a government with a plan.

That’s the leadership we need to elect in November. And that’s what I’ll keep fighting for. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EXiU-8WWAAAwcF8.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1258918363193016320/vid/320x320/XDofhzxSz4lMpUWk.mp4?tag=13

Trump wants to close his eyes & pretend that sending people back to work right now will magically solve all our problems. But every day that he refuses to lead on the public health crisis killing thousands of Americans daily is adding years to our economic recovery.

This is an unprecedented economic crisis. We must act right away to:

—Keep every employee on their payroll and guarantee their wages

—Provide $2,000 a month to every working-class man, woman and child in America https://twitter.com/ap/status/1258736597480230912 QT @AP BREAKING: Unemployment hits 14.7%, highest rate since the Depression, as U.S. shed 20 million jobs in April from viral outbreak. https://apnews.com/623da121a91a4951b3bcde201a46120d?utm_source=Twitter&utm_medium=AP&utm_campaign=SocialFlow
